N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.58 - Executive order no. 58: naming the executive commission to transfer the functions, powers, duties and obligations of the former department of social services and the division for youth to the offices of children and family services and temporary and disability assistance

State Regulations
WHEREAS, Chapter 436 of the Laws of 1997 created the

Department of Family Assistance, composed of two autonomous offices within the

Department: the Office of Children and Family Services and the Office of

Temporary and Disability Assistance; WHEREAS, these new Offices are responsible for the
functions, powers, duties and obligations of the former Department of Social

Services and the former Division for Youth; WHEREAS, the Department of Health and the Department of

Labor are statutorily responsible for other functions, powers, duties and
obligations of the former Department of Social Services; WHEREAS, Chapter 436 of the Laws of 1997 established an

Executive Commission responsible for developing a comprehensive legislative
proposal to implement the transfer of the functions, powers, duties and
obligations of the former Department of Social Services and the former Division
for Youth to the appropriate successor agencies; and
WHEREAS, it is proper that such Executive Commission
consist of individuals with the expertise, judgment and professional knowledge
needed to develop a comprehensive legislative proposal; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby order as follows: I. Executive Commission

There is hereby named an Executive Commission to develop a
comprehensive legislative proposal to implement the transfer of the functions, powers, duties and obligations for the former Department of Social Services and
the former Division for Youth to the appropriate successor agencies. The Executive Commission shall consist of the Commissioner
of the Office of Children and Family Services, or his designee; the

Commissioner of the Office of Temporary and Disability Assistance, or his
designee; the Commissioner of the Department of Labor, or his designee; the

Commissioner of the Department of Health, or her designee; the Director of

State Operations, or his designee; the Counsel to the Governor, or his
designee; the Director of the Division of the Budget, or her designee; and the

Executive Director of the Council on Children and Families, or her
designee. Members of the Commission shall receive no compensation but
shall be entitled to reimbursement for any necessary expenses incurred in
connection with the performance of their duties. II. Powers and Responsibilities of Commission

The Executive Commission shall develop a comprehensive
legislative proposal or proposals implementing the transfer of the functions, powers, duties and obligations of the former Department of Social Services and
the former Division for Youth to the appropriate successor agencies, consistent
with the provisions of Chapter 436 of the Laws of 1997. The Executive Commission shall submit such legislative
proposal or proposals to the Governor, the Temporary President of the Senate
and the Speaker of the Assembly as soon as practicable. III. Staff Support and Cooperation of State

Agencies

The departments represented on this Executive Commission
and any other State agencies, divisions, offices or departments shall cooperate
fully with the Commission and its mission. Such assistance may include, but
shall not be limited to, the use of agency staff and other administrative and
technical resources necessary for the Commission to fulfill its mission, including the provision of statistical and policy data in such form as is
requested by the Commission. IV. Dissolution

The Executive Commission shall be dissolved ninety days
after completion of its final legislative proposal fully implementing the
transfer of the functions, powers, duties and obligations of the former

Department of Social Services and the former Division for Youth to the
appropriate successor agencies. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: December 16, 1997
